data.description:
Congratulations! You just got a job at the Populistan International Airport, but this is not your usual airportâ€¦ You'll have to prove that you are capable of being a security agent at this prestigious, absolutely 0% corrupt airport.

Your job will consist of checking passports, making sure people are who they say they are and don't forge documentation, pat down people if you need to, find contraband and above all, follow the orders from your superior.

Nothing to Declare focuses on accessibility, and as such, you can play with one or two controllers. Both controllers are interchangeable to provide the best experience for every player!

changelog.change_log: - Fixed crash on startup (caused by update v51 of the OS)

- Fixed incorrect position of the player when teleporting.
- Fixed initial crash after trying to replay the demo.
- Fixed a bug that prevented the player to skip dialogs after completing the demo.

- Stability and performance improvements.
- Reduced the time per day by 60 seconds.
- Fixed an issue when teleporting and rotating (incorrect position of the player.)
- Fixed a bug that crashed the game on the last day (3).

- Added two documents explaining the Contraband Detector and the Megaphone.
- Added a tip to explain how to use the menu.
- Limited maximum number of food items to improve performance.
- Fixing some issues with the door.
- Fixing a bug that caused a crash on start, seemingly randomly.
- Fixed a bug that made it impossible to grab some items when switching rooms.

- Fixed an issue that prevented the game from starting in some cases.
- Better feedback for long loading times.
